chapter.title: Tuning
chapter.para: This chapter presents information about tuning &s4sa; to work optimally with &sap; applications.

sect1.title: Kernel: Page-Cache Limit
sect1.remark: The presentation of Problem/Solution is on one hand quite useful, on the other it is very inconsistent with the rest of this chapter. - sknorr, 2016-02-12

listitem.para: The kernel swaps out rarely accessed memory pages to use freed memory pages as cache to speed up file system operations, for example during backup operations.

&netweaver; and &hana; use large amounts of memory for accelerated access to business data. Parts of this memory are rarely accessed. When a user request needs to access paged-out memory, the response time is poor. It is even worse when an SAP application running on Java incurs a Java garbage collection: The system starts heavy page-in (disc I/O) activity and has a poor response time for an extended period of time.

&sles4sap; includes a kernel tuning option that allows the system administrator to limit the amount of page cache that the kernel uses when there is competition between application memory and page cache. This option tells the kernel that when the page cache is filled to the configured limit, application memory is more important and should thus not be paged out. No pages will be paged out if the memory footprint of the workload plus the configured page-cache limit do not exceed the amount of physical RAM in the system.

tip.para: The parameters vm.pagecache_limit_imb and vm.pagecache_limit_ignore_dirty are also configured by the tuned profiles delivered with the package sapconf.

sect1.title: Tuning Systems with saptune
sect1.remark: Question@hguo: Is "saptune solution NETWEAVER" the same as "tuned-adm profile sap-netweaver" (sap#1275776, sap#1557506, sap#1984787)? Why is the default tuning solution still "tuned-adm profile sap-netweaver" (sap#941735, sap#1557506)? - sknorr, 2016-08-11

Remark@hguo: saptune message typo: "_Plese_ note: the reverted note..." - sknorr, 2016-08-11
sect1.para: Using saptune, you can tune a system for &netweaver; and &hana;/&b1; applications. This method relies on the system tuning service tuned.

If you used the &sapwiz; to install an &sap; application, tuned is usually already active and configured with a profile for the application you installed. However, by default, the tuned profile applied using the &sapwiz; does not allow using saptune, instead it directly uses an equivalent &netweaver; or &hana; profile.
If you did not use the &sapwiz; to install an &sap; application, make sure that the packages tuned, saptune and sapconf are installed on your system.
